title: Cloonee Is Honoring His New Home of Los Angeles With the Largest Show of His Career
description: "This show will be the biggest of my career," the house music star said of his event at LA's City Market in June.
author: Nick Yopko

html:
"This show will be the biggest of my career," Cloonee said of his events at LA's City Market in June.

"This show will be the biggest of my career," Cloonee said of his events at LA's City Market in June.

  • Home
  • EVENTS

After finding a home in Los Angeles, Cloonee is ready to deliver what he's calling the biggest shows of his career in honor of the city that helped him grow.

The house music star in June is joining forces with Insomniac's Factory 93 brand to showcase the sounds of his label, Hellbent Records, at City Market in downtown Los Angeles. Fans of the British DJ will also be treated to the sounds of a handful of special guests, who have not been announced at the time of this writing.

Cloonee also got in front of the camera and opened up about the impact of his new home, explaining that LA's melting pot of cultures has influenced his artistic endeavors. He recently used his platform to raise money for those affected by the devastating LA wildfires, which scorched over 57,000 acres and killed at least 29 people.

"The people of LA have welcomed me with nothing but open arms," Cloonee said. "I'm very aware that I’m a guest in their many cultures, but they’ve never made me feel like that, and for that, I feel very lucky. Being in the melting pot of LA has unlocked parts of my artistic nature that I didn’t know I had."

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

"The last show here was in December 2023. We did back-to-back nights; both sold out, it was crazy, and it’s something I didn’t think I could do. But now we’re coming back to do it even bigger. This show will be the biggest of my career, in the city that I love, for the people who have helped me get here."

After Cloonee announced a show scheduled for Saturday, June 14th, it sold out in just 15 minutes, his team tells EDM.com. They've now added a second concert to take place a day prior. Tickets are on sale now.
